data.title: Top 4 Law Schools in Missouri
data.meta_description: Discover the top 4 law schools in Missouri here. Our experts take a look at what each school has to offer to help you make an informed decision for your future.
data.text:
Reviewed by:

David Merson

Former Head of Pre-Law Office, Northeastern University, & Admissions Officer, Brown University

Reviewed: 11/14/23

â

Interested in learning all about law schools in Missouri? Letâs take a look at what each one has to offer, so you can make an informed decision for your future.Â

â

Missouri, known as the Show-Me State, offers a blend of rural charm and vibrant cities. Whether you're into history, beautiful landscapes, or city life, Missouri has it all.

Now, speaking of education, Missouri also boasts some top-notch law schools. In this blog, we'll break down these schools, so whether you're a prospective law student or a professional looking to advance your legal career, you'll have the info you need to make the right choice for your future.Â

Top Law Schools In Missouri

Letâs zero in on Missouri's finest law schools. We'll highlight their strengths and key considerations to help you make an informed choice.

Law School U.S. News Ranking Acceptance Rate Median LSAT Median GPA Washington University in St. LouisSchool of Law #20 18% 172 3.94 University of MissouriSchool of Law #71 51.4% 160 3.7 Saint Louis UniversitySchool of Law #89 61.2% 156 3.54 University of MissouriâKansas City School of Law #135 52.1% 154 3.47

Missouri has four top-notch law schools, each with its own strengths, giving you plenty of choices for your legal education journey.Â

Whether you're looking at Washington University in St. Louis, the University of Missouri, Saint Louis University, or the University of MissouriâKansas City, they all offer different programs to match your legal career aspirations.

Washington University in St. Louis School of Law

â

Law School U.S. News Ranking Acceptance Rate Median LSAT Median GPA Bar Passage Rate Washington University in St. Louis School of Law #20 18% 172 3.94 92.3%

WashULaw is all about equipping its students with the skills and values needed to practice law effectively and ethically, all while advocating for justice in today's interconnected legal world.Â

At WashULaw, it isn't just about classes; it's a place where lively intellectual discussions happen and where groundbreaking research takes place. Their focus is on creating a close-knit, supportive community that values diversity and emphasizes strong connections to broader civic and professional networks.

University of Missouri School of Law

Law School U.S. News Ranking Acceptance Rate Median LSAT Median GPA Bar Passage Rate University of Missouri School of Law #71 51.4% 160 3.7 78.63%

Founded in 1872, the University of Missouri School of Law offers a well-rounded legal education that blends a strong traditional curriculum with hands-on experiences. Mizzou Law stands out with its commitment to experiential learning, boasting nationally recognized faculty who guide students through active participation in legal practice.Â

With options like clinics, dual degree programs, and certificate programs, students can tailor their education to their interests. The curriculum emphasizes problem-solving and practical skills, ensuring that graduates are well-prepared for the challenges of real-world legal practice.Â

Saint Louis University School of Law

âSource: Saint Louis University School of Law

Law School U.S. News Ranking Acceptance Rate Median LSAT Median GPA Bar Passage Rate Saint Louis University School of Law #89 61.2% 156 3.54 94.6%

Founded in 1843, Saint Louis University School of Law is the oldest law school west of the Mississippi River. It offers a well-rounded legal education with a strong faculty, diverse course options, and extensive clinical and professional skills experiences.

Located in Scott Hall, SLU LAW has deep community ties and a strong commitment to public service. Situated in St. Louis, students have exceptional access to law firms, corporations, government agencies, and non-profits, providing real-world exposure to the legal field.

The school's mission is to advance legal understanding and prepare students for professional success and personal fulfillment through leadership and service, guided by the Jesuit tradition of academic excellence and respect for individual differences.

University of MissouriâKansas City School of Law

Source: US News

Law School U.S. News Ranking Acceptance Rate Median LSAT Median GPA Bar Passage Rate University of MissouriâKansas City School of Law #135 52.1% 154 3.47 78.6%

Back in 1895, the Kansas City School of Law had its humble beginnings as a private, independent institution right in the heart of Kansas City. It was the brainchild of three enterprising young lawyers: William Borland, Edward Ellison, and Elmer Powell, with plenty of support from the legal circles of the time.

Fast forward to today, and you have the University of MissouriâKansas City School of Law. They've come a long way, and their commitment remains strong. Their mission is clear: a legal education that revolves around students connects with the community, and is driven by a passion for justice.Â

UMKC School of Law offers a range of academic programs to ensure students are well-equipped for success in the legal arena. Their tradition of legal excellence, stretching back to their founding, continues to shape their mission of serving students and the broader community.

How to Find More Law Schools Near Missouri

Ready to pinpoint the best law schools in Missouri? Our free tool lets you do just thatâfilter your options by region across the United States and find the one that's tailor-made for you.

FAQs

Curious about law schools in Missouri? We've got answers to your common questions about admissions, programs, and more.Â

1. What Is The Best Law School In Missouri?

Washington University in St. Louis School of Law is widely considered the top law school in Missouri. It's known for its exceptional academic programs and a solid reputation in the legal world.

2. How Many Law Schools Are In Missouri?

Missouri is home to three law schools: Washington University in St. Louis School of Law, the University of Missouri School of Law, and Saint Louis University School of Law.

3. Is There an Online Law School In Missouri?

Yes, there are online law degrees offered in Missouri. WashULaw provides online Master of Legal Studies (MLS) and Master of Laws (LLM) programs. Mizzou also offers an LLM in Dispute Resolution online, providing flexibility for students to attend classes from anywhere.
